page.title: 01Boynton
page.content: This area is a farming area. It has 7 main farms. The main crops they grow are wheat, barley, oil seed rape, potatoes, cabbages and turnips. There are some milking cows and sheep as well. The farm houses were mainly made of chalk but the farmers have built brick extensions on some of them and have modernised them. Most of the farmers only employ 1 or 2 workers and use a lot of farm machinery. The village of Boynton is in this area. There are 143 people living in 32 houses. There are no shops, there is no post office but there is a school and a church. There are 30 children in this school who come from Boynton, Rudston and Grindale. They come to school on a daily school bus. Most people go into Bridlington for shopping.
